TopicTitle: Planetary Transfer Window was it adjusted for 0.25?

Articles.Content:
So I came across this google doc....

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AnpCrrNNGwY7dEQ2X0l2QWlnSE91NjNjQnJhWFoxaUE&usp=sharing#gid=0

Where it say the Duna window start as early as day 58

But using Alex Moon or Mechjeb, The sub 1100m/s Dv window doesn't show up anywhere nearly until day 200+

so was the planetary start position updated for 0.25 causing that spreadsheet to be no longer applicable?

Does anyone have an updated spreadsheet applicable to 0.25?

Edited November 30, 2014 by bitslizer
The sub 1100 one doesn't no. There are several low transfer options sooner

That spreadsheet is using Earth (24-hour) days.

By default, I think alexmoon's window planner now uses Kerbin (6-hour) days.

Can you reconcile the dates if you convert between the two?

That spreadsheet is using Earth (24-hour) days.

By default, I think alexmoon's window planner now uses Kerbin (6-hour) days.

Can you reconcile the dates if you convert between the two?

Duh!... it convert perfectly! Thanks for pointing out that its in Earth Day

I guess I need to change from a Duna mission to a Eve mission (Kerbin Day 40ish 1500 m/s Dv needed), time to do the Eve challenge I guess... going to get cracking on building a returnable Eve lander and kerbin launch system
You don't HAVE to wait for the lowest-dV transfer. You can launch to Duna starting around day 40 for less than 2000 m/s.
